channel.title: market-report on Daniel Antal, CFA
channel.description: Recent content in market-report on Daniel Antal, CFA

item.title: Eurpoean Comparison: How Many People Ever Pay For Music, Film or Software
item.description: In our recent private copying reports we compiled European survey data relevant to analysis. In Europe, there is a big difference between the use of electronic entertainment devices in richer and poorer countries. Nevertheless, the real difference is between the number of people who sometimes and who never pay for downloaded music, films and software. In some countries of Europe, less then 10 percent of the population ever pays for the content that is loaded to their computers, smartphones and tablets.

item.title: CEEMP Session: Licensing, How To Tackle The Value Gap And A Discussion on Licensing Initiatives
item.description: CEEMID had the honor to participate in the third panel of CEEMP in Warsaw together with Ben McEwen from ICE; Jules Parker from Spotify and Dominic Houston from Netflix, and Chris Butler from Music Sales, who is also the chairperson of ICMP. Our panel was moderated by Nigel Elderton from peermusic, who is also the new chairperson of PRS in the UK. Jules from Spotify spoke about their new initiative, Spotify for Publishers.
